https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2801403-arturo-vidal-convicted-in-2017-nightclub-fight-fined-923000

Arturo Vidal Convicted in 2017 Nightclub Fight, Fined $923,000

Barcelona midfielder Arturo Vidal will have to pay a $923,000 fine after being convicted of aggravated battery Wednesday, according to TMZ Sports.

The charge stems from a 2017 fight at a nightclub in Germany where he reportedly smashed a bottle over another person's head, causing a gash and a traumatic brain injury.

He faced a maximum of 10 years in jail with the sentence but he and his half-brother Sandrino, who was also involved, were only fined.

While Vidal did not appear in court as he was away on international duty with the Chilean national team, he was convicted in absentia while the victim appeared as a witness.
"Nobody ever apologised to me," the victim said, per German publication Merkur(h/t Stephan Uersfeld of ESPN FC).

Vidal was a member of Bayern Munich at the time of the incident but transferred to Barcelona in August. The 31-year-old has appeared in nine matches this season, including six in La Liga, totaling one assist.

"I feel very happy with the team, as we have a good atmosphere, we work together and with a common goal at the club level."

"Messi is an exemplary captain, not only in talent, but on a personal level. He does not talk much, but he teaches everything on the pitch. He is a key player for us and for the dressing room. He does not need to speak, as when he is angry everyone knows it."

I find Malcom's treatment cruel. Barça gets in the way of his transfer, fooled the player, his family and agent, now the coach doesn't even give him chances in the first team.

You know, this reminds me of how the club treats La Masia players lately.

replies.msg:
Alen Halilovic is ready to quit AC Milan.

The Croatian midfielder joined Milan this summer from Hamburg, but has failed to make a first team impression so far this term.

Sportmediaset says Halilovic is already planning to leave in January and has instructed agents to get him a move.

The former Barcelona midfielder favours a return to Spain and Girona have been contacted.

The 22 year-old spent two years in the region with Barca B.
